abstract: Google has been warned that it may be violating European Union privacy laws by storing search data for up to two years.
snippet: Google has been warned that it may be violating European Union privacy laws by storing search data for up to two years.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN, May 25  Google has been warned that it may be violating European Union privacy laws by storing search data from its users for up to two years, the latest example of a United States technology giant whose practices face a collision with European standards.

headline.main: E.U. Probes Google Over Data Retention Policy
headline.print_headline: European Union Warns Google on Possible Violations of Privacy Law

byline.original: By KEVIN J. O’BRIEN and THOMAS CRAMPTON
